comments:
I get a "Could not save task list" every 10 min or so. I never used to get this error but there are a few new things that might have caused it:
* Installed 3.2M4.
* I also made a seperate plugin directory (see http://timshadel.com/blog/2004/08/28/1093715447000.html for a decent desc). 
* Eclipse is installed in eclipse/3.2M4 but i've created a junction (windows version of a symbolic link) called eclipse/current which points to the 3.2M4 dir. (Although i seriously seriously doubt this will effect anything)
* I'm using 2 new plugins: RDT (ruby dev tools) and RadRails. I don't know how they would effect mylar.core though :)

I have no idea what could be causing this. I'm using a fresh workspace (ie. i didn't upgrade to 3.2M4 and keep using old workspace). Below is the error log:

java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.mylar.tasklist.internal.TaskListWriter.writeTaskList(TaskListWriter.java:96)
at org.eclipse.mylar.tasklist.internal.TaskListManager.saveTaskList(TaskListManager.java:92)
at org.eclipse.mylar.tasklist.internal.TaskListSaveManager.saveTaskListAndContexts(TaskListSaveManager.java:68)
at org.eclipse.mylar.tasklist.internal.TaskListSaveManager.saveRequested(TaskListSaveManager.java:58)
at org.eclipse.mylar.tasklist.internal.BackgroundSaveTimer$SaveJob.run(BackgroundSaveTimer.java:85)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)


eclipse.buildId=I20051215-1506
java.version=1.5.0_05
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_AU
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

It appears that the Bugzilla Client Plug-in failed to load properly, so that Mylar fails to write out the task list sine it can not find the Bugzilla task externalizer.  This means that your task list is not being written, which is a serious bug that you are seeing triggered by the automatic save facility.  You should be able to manually trigger this bug on any task list chante (e.g. adding a task).

Could you attach your .metadata/.log file since any plug-in loading failures should be visible in there.  Also, ensure that your task list is saved somewhere and take a look at the instructions in: http://www.eclipse.org/mylar/doc/faq.php

Created an attachment (id=32574)
.metadata/.log and .mylar/tasklist.xml

Here is a copy of .metadata/.log and .mylar/tasklist.xml

Yup, it looks like the task list is failing to start properly, as is your PHPEclipse plugin.  That dev build of Mylar should be more robust to this kind of thing so first try that and let me know if you get any task list save failures.  If that doesn't work, try to get your Eclipse to the point where no plug-ins like the PHP one fail to load in case there is some underlying configuration problem.

Since the last update, I don't get the popup anymore, i'm not noticing any problems at all with the mylar tasklist...but there are errors in the log.

FYI, i'm not actually using mylar at all at the moment. I'm just using it to display bugzilla reports. :)
*** Bug 123428 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Resolved for 0.4.7.  The only Mylar entries in the log were warnings that the task list wasn't automatically saved.  If you ever see those again please post on this or on a new report.
